<p align="center">
<b>𝗗𝗘𝗣𝗟𝗢𝗬𝗠𝗘𝗡𝗧 𝗠𝗘𝗧𝗛𝗢𝗗𝗦</b>

<h3 align="center">
    ─「 ᴅᴇᴩʟᴏʏ ᴏɴ ʜᴇʀᴏᴋᴜ 」─
</h3>

<p align="center"><a href="https://dashboard.heroku.com/new?template=https://github.com/YADUVANSHIXD/StringGenBot"> <img src="https://img.shields.io/badge/Deploy%20On%20Heroku-black?style=for-the-badge&logo=heroku" width="220" height="38.45"/></a></p>

<details>
<summary><h3>
- <b> ᴠᴘs/ʟᴏᴄᴀʟ ᴅᴇᴘʟᴏʏᴍᴇɴᴛ ᴍᴇᴛʜᴏᴅ </b>
</h3></summary>

- Get your [Necessary Variables](https://github.com/YADUVANSHIXD/StringGenBot/blob/master/sample.env)
- Upgrade and Update by :
`sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get upgrade -y`
- Install required packages by :
`sudo apt-get install python3-pip`
- Install pip by :
`sudo pip3 install -U pip`
- Clone the repository by :
`git clone https://github.com/YADUVANSHIXD/StringGenBot && cd StringGenBot`
- Install requirements by :
`pip3 install -U -r requirements.txt`
- Fill your variables in the env by :
`vi sample.env`<br>
Press `I` on the keyboard for editing env<br>
Press `Ctrl+C` when you're done with editing env and `:wq` to save the env<br>
- Rename the env file by :
`mv sample.env .env`
- Install tmux to keep running your bot when you close the terminal by :
`sudo apt install tmux && tmux`
- Finally run the bot by :
`bash start`
- For getting out from tmux session<br>
Press `Ctrl+b` and then `d`

<p align="center">
  <img src="https://te.legra.ph/file/fa5b692e4ddb87559db17.jpg">
</p>

</details>
